trans-unit.source: Enforce a design paradigm where only one instance of the script may be running

seg-source.mrk: Enforce a design paradigm where only one instance of the script may be running

target.mrk: Enforce a design paradigm where only one instance of the script may be running

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: String to identify the occurrence of the script. This string may not contain the \ character unless you are placing the object in a namespace (See Remarks).

seg-source.mrk: String to identify the occurrence of the script.
This string may not contain the \ character unless you are placing the object in a namespace (See Remarks).

target.mrk: String to identify the occurrence of the script.
This string may not contain the \ character unless you are placing the object in a namespace (See Remarks).

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Behavior options.

target.mrk: [optional]
Behavior options.

trans-unit.source: 0 - Exit the script with the exit code -1 if another instance already exists.

seg-source.mrk: 0 - Exit the script with the exit code -1 if another instance already exists.

target.mrk: 0 - Exit the script with the exit code -1 if another instance already exists.

trans-unit.source: 1 - Return from the function without exiting the script.

seg-source.mrk: 1 - Return from the function without exiting the script.

target.mrk: 1 - Return from the function without exiting the script.

trans-unit.source: 2 - Allow the object to be accessed by anybody in the system. This is useful if specifying a "Global\" object in a multi-user environment.

seg-source.mrk: 2 - Allow the object to be accessed by anybody in the system.
This is useful if specifying a "Global\" object in a multi-user environment.

target.mrk: 2 - Allow the object to be accessed by anybody in the system.
This is useful if specifying a "Global\" object in a multi-user environment.

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: The handle to the object used for synchronization (a mutex).

seg-source.mrk: The handle to the object used for synchronization (a mutex).

target.mrk: The handle to the object used for synchronization (a mutex).

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: You can place the object in a namespace by prefixing your object name with either "Global\" or "Local\". "Global\" objects combined with the flag 2 are useful in multi-user environments.

seg-source.mrk: You can place the object in a namespace by prefixing your object name with either "Global\" or "Local\".
"Global\" objects combined with the flag 2 are useful in multi-user environments.

target.mrk: You can place the object in a namespace by prefixing your object name with either "Global\" or "Local\".
"Global\" objects combined with the flag 2 are useful in multi-user environments.
